DOC.brief_summary: This study will expand the Department of Defense (DoD) one time, face-to-face post deployment BATTLEMIND training for spouses of Operation Enduring Freedom/Operation Iraqi Freedom (OEF/OIF) Guard/Reserve service members into year-long, telephone groups focusing on education, skills building and support. The goal is to build spouses' resilience to cope with reintegration, help them serve as a support system for returning service members, and ease the transition for families post-deployment.
DOC.brief_title: Reintegration: The Role of Spouse Telephone BATTLEMIND Pilot Study
DOC.criteria: 1. have a spouse who participated in OEF/OIF and is at least 1 month postdeployment; 2. if not married, must have lived as married for at least one year; 3. live with the service member when not deployed; 4. have been a spouse/significant other throughout the service member's deployment period; 5. and have a telephone. 1. current diagnosis of schizophrenia or other major mental illness; 2. auditory impairment that would make telephone use difficult; or 3. service member refusal of assent for spouse to participate.
